### RenumberBlocks() {#ac85349aab432e6b7d8b2e8926048a6de}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MachineFunction::RenumberBlocks (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; MBB=nullptr)</>}>
RenumberBlocks - This discards all of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> numbers and recomputes them.

This discards all of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> numbers and recomputes them.

This guarantees that the MBB numbers are sequential, dense, and match the ordering of the blocks within the function. If a specific <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> is specified, only that block and those after it are renumbered.

### viewCFG() {#abc50ab3d596a1b18095f8c1d9bfcc7da}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void MachineFunction::viewCFG () const">
viewCFG - This function is meant for use from the debugger.

You can just say &#39;call F-&gt;<a href="#abc50ab3d596a1b18095f8c1d9bfcc7da">viewCFG()</a>&#39; and a ghostview window should pop up from the program, displaying the CFG of the current function with the code for each basic block inside. This depends on there being a &#39;dot&#39; and &#39;gv&#39; program in your path.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinefunction-h/#l00903">903</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinefunction-h">MachineFunction.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinefunction-cpp/#l00740">740</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinefunction-cpp">MachineFunction.cpp</a>.

### viewCFGOnly() {#a29663c97a5b2652c10a2130245fd923c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void MachineFunction::viewCFGOnly () const">
viewCFGOnly - This function is meant for use from the debugger.

It works just like viewCFG, but it does not include the contents of basic blocks into the nodes, just the label. If you are only interested in the CFG this can make the graph smaller.

### clear() {#a22be70aa270d893389de25d2a197e567}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void MachineFunction::clear ()">
Clear all the members of this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a>, but the ones used to initialize again the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a>.

More specifically, this deallocates all the dynamically allocated objects and get rids of all the XXXInfo data structure, but keeps unchanged the references to Fn, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/target">Target</a>, and FunctionNumber.

### finalizeDebugInstrRefs {#a5bce8dbd0e078a0ea0821917ab1f4873}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void MachineFunction::finalizeDebugInstrRefs ()">
Finalise any partially emitted debug instructions.

These are DBG&#95;INSTR&#95;REF instructions where we only knew the vreg of the value they use, not the instruction that defines that vreg. Once isel finishes, we should have enough information for every DBG&#95;INSTR&#95;REF to point at an instruction (or DBG&#95;PHI).

### salvageCopySSA {#af7d45fc1c0744243f06cc0041f1142f2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>auto MachineFunction::salvageCopySSA (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a>, <a href="#a2097b2a990ffa425c1885d12a5e33ef8">DebugInstrOperandPair</a> &gt; &amp; DbgPHICache)</>}>
Find the underlying defining instruction / operand for a COPY instruction while in SSA form.

Copies do not actually define values  they move them between registers. Labelling a COPY-like instruction with an instruction number is to be avoided as it makes value numbers non-unique later in compilation. This method follows the definition chain for any sequence of COPY-like instructions to find whatever non-COPY-like instruction defines the copied value; or for parameters, creates a DBG&#95;PHI on entry. May insert instructions into the entry block! <code>MI</code> The copy-like instruction to salvage. <code>DbgPHICache</code> A container to cache already-solved COPYs. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
An instruction/operand pair identifying the defining value.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinefunction-h/#l00629">629</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinefunction-h">MachineFunction.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinefunction-cpp/#l01049">1049</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinefunction-cpp">MachineFunction.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### substituteDebugValuesForInst {#a30233b5b4decf678ec7ed144ac1f729b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MachineFunction::substituteDebugValuesForInst (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; Old, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; New, unsigned MaxOperand=UINT&#95;MAX)</>}>
Create substitutions for any tracked values in <code>Old</code>, to point at <code>New</code>.

Needed when we re-create an instruction during optimization, which has the same signature (i.e., def operands in the same place) but a modified instruction type, flags, or otherwise. An example: <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/x86">X86</a> moves are sometimes transformed into equivalent LEAs. If the two instructions are not the same opcode, limit which operands to examine for substitutions to the first N operands by setting <code>MaxOperand</code>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinefunction-h/#l00614">614</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinefunction-h">MachineFunction.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinefunction-cpp/#l01020">1020</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinefunction-cpp">MachineFunction.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
